answers: Pieter Paul Rubens AND Michelangelo Merisi da Caravaggio
Madonna of the Rosary [or Madonna del Rosario]
Descent from the Cross [or Deposition from the Cross]
parts: Name these two artists. One of them made a copy of the other’s Entombment of Christ, as well as many other paintings, while residing at the court of Vincenzo I, and later painted The Consequences of War.

A letter by Rubens to Duke Vincenzo remarks that Caravaggio’s two “most beautiful paintings” are Judith Killing Holofernes and this other one, which Rubens and the Breughel family acquired in 1618. A red draping adorns the top of this Caravaggio altarpiece, in which Mary gestures towards Saint Dominic at the left.

Caravaggio’s influence shows in Rubens’ painting of this scene for the Confraternity of Arquebusiers. Rogier van der Weyden’s version of this scene, which shows Mary fainting, was painted for a guild of crossbowmen.

answers: Agricultural Revolution [accept Arab Agricultural Revolution or Second Agricultural Revolution]
Nabataeans [or Nabatu or al-Anbat] (The capital is Petra.)
saqiyah [or sakias, or tablia, or Persian wheels; prompt on flywheel or tympanum]
parts: Give this two-word name which also identifies a period in Britain from the mid 17th through 19th centuries, during which land output greatly increased due to enclosure and better use of crop rotation methods.

Two Arab groups of this name title Ibn Wahshiyya’s 10th century book of agriculture, magic, and astrology, which he claimed to have translated from a 20,000 year old Syriac text. One of those groups of this name lived in Iraq, while the other made its capital in a city accessed through a narrow passage called the Siq.

Production throughout the Islamic world was enhanced by these water-lifting wheels, invented by the Ptolemies and Nubians, which improved on the earlier shaduf by using the labor of oxen instead of humans.

answers: Alessandro Manzoni (The novel is The Betrothed.)
parts: Name this author. In his best-known novel, a criminal called “The Unnamed” releases a woman from a castle and miraculously converts to Catholicism upon meeting Cardinal Borromeo.

Perhaps the greatest reflection of Manzoni’s turn against Enlightenment ideals is this poem, written upon the death of Napoleon Bonaparte, which states “never bent / Beneath death’s hand a haughtier soul.”

Manzoni’s turn towards liberal Catholicism, and away from Enlightenment idealism, is often contrasted with this Italian Romantic author of the same era, who wrote numerous Canti and the sonnet “The Infinite.”
Name this instrument which is featured along with a biwa and western orchestra in Toru Takemitsu’s piece November Steps. This traditional Japanese flute is usually made of bamboo.
This film composer featured the shakuhachi heavily in his score for Memoirs of a Geisha. You may know him better for composing Darth Vader’s theme song.

Toru Takemitsu’s score to this film includes the track “Flute of Darkness,” in which a shakuhachi plays piercing high notes as several buildings burn in the background, as well as the track “Hell’s Picture Scroll.”
Name this symbol, which also represents an operator on exterior algebras named for Hodge. The complex conjugate of a complex number is either denoted with a horizontal bar over z or by this symbol.

Moyal star-product operator algebras can be constructed from any of the manifolds with structures named for this mathematician. In addition to satisfying the Jacobi identity and Leibniz’s rule, a binary map named for this mathematician is invariant under canonical transformations in Hamiltonian mechanics.

That construction can formally be done using the 'quantization formula' named for this Russian-French Fields medallist. Ed Witten’s conjecture about two models of quantum gravity sharing a partition function was proven by this mathematician in his 1992 PhD thesis.
A classic illustration of SFE is this problem introduced by A.C. Yao. In this problem, two people use a third party to determine who is wealthier without revealing their net worth to each other.
A practical implementation of SFE is fundamental to making this type of computing secure. In this type of computing, users run their programs on remote servers rather than local machines.

One of the first attempts at practical SFE was the Fairplay compiler, which implemented Yao’s original protocol that exchanges inputs to garbled Boolean circuits using oblivious transfer. Simple oblivious transfer protocols can be built from this key exchange protocol that allows two parties to establish a shared secret over an insecure channel.

answers: second-harmonic generation [or SHG; prompt on sum-frequency generation; prompt on harmonic generation]
parts: Name this technique of completely characterizing ultrashort laser pulses. This technique measures an auto-spectrogram by having the pulse gate itself in a nonlinear optical medium.

FROG is equivalent to an autocorrelator except a spectrograph takes the place of a detector that uses this effect to create electrical current. In this effect, photons eject electrons from the surface of a material.
A popular FROG variant relies on this effect driven by a second-order nonlinearity in the susceptibility. This effect sees photons are coherently combined to form new photons with twice the energy.
